titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Giard Papers
titlestmt.author: by Andrea Benefiel and Molly Wheeler

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 04:13

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The papers consist of photographs, correspondence, diaries, financial papers, and printed materials documenting Robert Giard's career as a photographer and personal life, spanning the years 1972 to 2002. The bulk of the papers contain photographic prints by Giard in several sizes of various subjects, including portraits of gay and lesbian writers, landscapes, nudes, still lifes, and portraits of the Thanks Be To Grandmother Winifred Foundation grant recipients.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Jonathan G. Silin on the Eugene G. O'Neill Memorial Fund, 2004. Gift of Jonathan G. Silin, 2011.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Robert Giard Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Robert Giard Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization, at the time of acquisition. Further organization, rehousing, and description were carried out in 2013.

This collection is comprised of material formerly classed as: Uncat MSS 765 and Uncat MSS 1274. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, according to month and year of acquisition.

The finding aid for this collection is compiled from individual preliminary lists for each acquisition that were created at or around the time of receipt by the library. The preliminary lists were migrated to comply with current archival descriptive standards and merged into a single file in 2007-2008. As part of the migration, modifications were made to the formatting of individual lists; however, the content of the lists was neither modified nor verified. Box 271 contains print-outs of original inventories of 16" x 20" photographs. These inventories contain detailed information not found in this finding aid and originate from a data export of a FileMaker Pro Database acquired with the collection.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Printed material received with the collection was removed for separate cataloging and can be accessed by searching the library's online catalog.

bioghist.head: Robert Giard (1939-2002)
bioghist.p: Robert Giard was an American photographer, born in Hartford, Connecticut in 1939. He received a Bachelor of Arts from Yale University in 1961, and Master of Arts in Comparative Literature from Boston University in 1965. In 1972 he began to take photographs, focusing on landscapes and portraits of his friends, artists, writers, and nudes. His monograph Particular Voices: Portraits of Gay and Lesbian Writers, published by MIT Press in 1997, contains a selection from over 500 portraits he had taken in the previous decade. In 1996, Giard was commissioned to document the 321 grant recipients of the Thanks Be To Grandmother Winifred Foundation. The grant recipients were women over the age of 54 whose projects benefitted adult women. From 1996 to 2001, Giard traveled across the U. S. to photograph each year's grant recipients. He died in 2002 of a heart attack.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of photographs, correspondence, diaries, financial papers, and printed materials documenting Robert Giard's career as a photographer and personal life, spanning the years 1972 to 2002. The bulk of the papers contain photographic prints by Giard in several sizes of various subjects, including portraits of gay and lesbian writers, landscapes, nudes, still lifes, and portraits of the Thanks Be To Grandmother Winifred Foundation grant recipients.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two groupings: I. February 2005 Acquisition, 1972-2002. II. October 2011 Acquisition, 1988-2001.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Jonathan G. Silin on the Eugene G. O'Neill Memorial Fund, 2004.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This group of material is organized into five series: Correspondence, Professional Papers, Photograph Work Prints, Oversize Photographs (16" x 20"), and Photographs (11" x 14").

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This group contains correspondence, professional papers diaries, financial papers, photographs, printed material, journals, and other related papers.

Box 271 contains print-outs of original inventories of 16" x 20" photographs. These inventories contain detailed information not found in this finding aid and originate from a data export of a FileMaker Pro Database acquired with the collection.

Personal and professional correspondence including articles on gay writers, publishers, and artists; clippings; postcards and mailings
Miscellaneous diaries and notebooks chronicling Giard's early involvement with photographic ideas and interest in literature, interspersed with news clipping, literary quotes, sketches
Papers pertaining to Thanks Be to Grandmother Winifred Foundation project, extensive travel notes, and descriptions of the meetings and photographic sessions with the 250 grant recipients
Papers pertaining to Thanks Be to Grandmother Winifred Foundation project, extensive travel notes, and descriptions of the meetings and photographic sessions with the 250 grant recipients

Complete set of photocopies of Giard's original diaries related to the Gay and Lesbian Writers Series, photocopies describing meetings and photographic sessions with the writers (original diaries are in the permanent collection of the New York Public Library)
Desk files, weekly calendars, grant proposals, resumes, professional correspondence, exhibition announcements and brochures, obituaries, awards, articles, plans for future projects

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: LSF# A set of the portfolio inserts, including the colophon and introduction by Gene Thornton, former critic for the New York Times, is included in the Yale package, however the group of prints listed below does not represent the entire portfolio as a print of the image "Two Deer" is not available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Note: A set of the portfolio inserts, including the colophon and introduction by Gene Thornton, former critic for the New York Times, is included in the Yale package, however the group of prints listed above does not represent the entire portfolio as a print of the image "Two Deer" is not available.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into nine subseries: Portraits, India, Landscapes, Nudes, Balloon Series, Neo-Classical Series, Piano Series, Beach Sequence, and Assorted Nudes.
